CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 22, 1944, pg. 1, reads: "A Lady...Her Dog...Her Coat - Among her accomplishments Mis Lionel Hampton lists her position as business manager of her famous husband's orchestra as the most engrossing. in above photo, Mrs. Hampton is shown with her Scotch terrier "Tempo," the band's mascot.  Not to be glossed over is the fur coat she is wearing...it is a $6,000 stone marten of the latest design.  (See story on theatrical page) - Harris Photo."Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 22, 1944, pg. 15, reads: "The caption is no exaggeration, for Gladys Hampton, wife of the famous bandleader, is just that.  In addition to handling the administrative affairs of the Lionel Hampton orchestra, she is more than adept at several other things... - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Gladys Hampton wearing dark gloves and fur coat, standing in between sofa and chest of drawers, in Stanley Theatre
